list_definition.definition: to begin (a line of writing) farther in from the margin than the other lines

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You should indent the first line of each new paragraph.

list_definition.definition: (also indentation) the space left at the beginning of a line, eg the first line of a paragraph.

list_ex_of_english: The leaves have scalloped edges, have a hairy surface, and are indented with veins.
By indenting the sides of the structure three feet, he opened a slender airshaft between abutting buildings.
The volcano is shaped like a foot; the northeast coast is prominently indented across 20kmmi 0 of shoreline.
All that survives of the original formation is an irregular perimeter of low, indented ridges surrounding the lava-resurfaced interior.
The senior medical officer had foreseen that supplies of drugs and dressings might need replenishing at about the end of the year, and had indented to us for them.
The outer lip slightly indented, sharp, articulated with pinkish-brown, with an inner opaque white band.
Final portions of the indents are now being shipped.
The fruit is spherical, indented, becoming purple or black when ripe.
